text: How Python web frameworks, WSGI and CGI fit together
I have a Bluehost account where I can run Python scripts as CGI.
I guess it's the simplest CGI, because to run I have to define the following in .htaccess:

code:
Options +ExecCGI
AddType text/html py
AddHandler cgi-script .py

text: Now, whenever I look up web programming with Python, I hear a lot about WSGI and how most frameworks use it.

But I just don't understand how it all fits together, especially when my web server is given (Apache running at a host's machine) and not something I can really play with (except defining .htaccess commands).
How are WSGI, CGI, and the frameworks all connected?
What do I need to know, install, and do if I want to run a web framework (say web.py or CherryPy) on my basic CGI configuration?
